results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 9, August 1994
results.creator_credit: Otter Publishing, Stuart Clarke and Phillip Keir
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-009

results.title: The Magic pudding
results.creator_credit: Gerry Travers, Ed Frost and Energee Entertainment
results.brief_description: This is a magical animated version of the classic Australian children’s novel by Norman Lindsay. Featuring the vocal talents of John Cleese, Sam Neill, Geoffrey Rush, Hugo Weaving, Jack Thompson, Toni Collette and Mary Coustas, the film cannot fail to delight children of all ages. Come join Albert the Magic Pudding, Bunyip Bluegum, Bill Barnacle and Sam Sawnoff as they fight off the attempts of pudding thieves Possum and Wombat (directed from a distance by Buncle), and try valiantly to solve the mystery of the disappearance of Bunyip’s parents.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.creator_credit: Luci Clark, South Australian Film Corporation, Newfilms and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Carcass classification has taken much of the guesswork out of pig marketing. As a more objective measure in assessing the quality of the pork, classification is better for both producer and consumer. Explains the benefits to the farmer, and the way modern computers program and store production details. Cast includes Brian Moore, Flo Watson, Peter Brechin, Darcy Button, Keith Arnfield.
